maml:description.maml:para: Compares the language text files in two folders (original and modified) and calculates the deltas. The result of the comparison is a language text file per object with the calculated delta.

Use the Compare-NAVAppApplicationObjectLanguage cmdlet to calculate the delta between an original version and modified version of language text files. The resulting delta language text files can then be included in a NAV App package by using the New-NAVAppPackage cmdlet.

The Compare-NAVAppApplicationObjectLanguage cmdlet compares all of the language text files in the two specified folders and creates a delta language text file per object that includes the differences. The language text files to compare must be in the format of exported multilanguage files created by using the Export-NAVApplicationObjectLanguage cmdlet or the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Development Environment. You can compare two language text files that contain multiple application objects or multiple language text files containing a single object, or any combination therein. The cmdlet will compare the translations for all objects across all of the language text files in the specified folders.

The cmdlet creates a language text file per object that includes all of the translated \*ML properties and text constants (deltas) for that object. For example, you export the text strings for the Microsoft Dynamics NAV objects that you will be providing translations for to text files in a MLORIGINAL folder. You then put a copy of the exported text file into a MLMODIFIED folder and add your translated strings directly to the file.

You then use the Compare-NAVAppApplicationObjectLanguage cmdlet to compare the language text files in the MLORIGINAL and MLMODIFIED folders, saving the resulting delta language text files to a MLDELTA folder. Then when using the New-NAVAppPackage cmdlet to create the NAV App package, the MLDELTA folder is provided for the -SourcePath parameter.
Specifies the folder containing the original language files to compare.
Specifies the folder containing the modified language files to compare.
Specifies the folder where the calculated delta language files will be placed.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation to overwrite an existing file at the given path.
Specifies the folder containing the original language files to compare.
Specifies the folder containing the original language files to compare.
This is an alias of the OriginalPath parameter.
Specifies the folder containing the modified language files to compare.
Specifies the folder containing the modified language files to compare.
This is an alias of the ModifiedPath parameter.
Specifies the folder where the calculated delta language files will be placed.
Specifies the folder where the calculated delta language files will be placed.
This is an alias of the DeltaPath parameter.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation to overwrite an existing file at the given path.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example compares the language text files in the MLORIGINAL and MLMODIFIED folders, creating the resulting delta language text files in the MLDELTA folder. When the comparison completes, a summary is shown.

This example compares the language text files in the MLORIGINAL and MLMODIFIED folders, creating the resulting delta language text files in the MLDELTA folder. The -Confirm parameter specifies that the user must confirm the process. When the comparison completes, a summary is shown.

This example compares the language text files in the MLORIGINAL and MLMODIFIED folders, creating the resulting delta language text files in the MLDELTA folder. The -Force parameter specifies that an existing file in the delta folder with the same name will be overwritten without prompting the user. When the comparison completes, a summary is shown.

This example compares the language text files in the MLORIGINAL and MLMODIFIED folders, creating the resulting delta language text files in the MLDELTA folder. The -PassThru parameter returns a FileInfo object for each delta language file that is created by the comparison. When the comparison completes, a summary is shown.

maml:description.maml:para: Loads a manifest for an NAV App from an external source.
Use the Get-NAVAppManifest cmdlet to load a manifest from an NAV App from an external source, such as an .xml file.
Specifies the path to a file with an NAV App manifest.
Specifies the path to a file with an NAV App manifest.
By value and by property name: Path

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 1 ----------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-NAVAppManifest -Path '.\Manifest-Proseware SmartApp.xml'
AppId : 3c88160c-e0eb-4fe1-b4f6-011e45d74b10 AppName : Proseware SmartApp AppPublisher : Proseware, Inc. AppDescription : First NAV App by Proseware AppVersion : 2.3.4.500 AppCompatibilityId : 2.0.0.0 AppPrivacyStatement: http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/privacypolicy.aspx AppEula : http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/ULA.aspx AppHelp : http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/Support.aspx AppUrl : http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/ AppLogo : AppScreenShots : {} Capabilities : {} Prerequisites : {} Dependencies : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets a NAV App manifest from an XML manifest file.
This example gets a NAV App manifest from an XML manifest file and then passes the manifest to the New-NAVAppPackage cmdlet to create a new NAV App package.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new in-memory manifest object with the specified NAV App metadata.

Use the New-NAVAppManifest cmdlet to create a new in-memory manifest object that defines a NAV App along with its required prerequisites and dependencies. The manifest object can then be written to disk using the New-NAVAppManifestFile cmdlet. The manifest is required when creating the NAV App package file (.navx) using the New-NAVAppPackage cmdlet. The manifest property values can be changed using the Set-NAVAppManifest cmdlet.
Specifies the name of the NAV App.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NAV App help site.
Specifies a generic hyperlink.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App, such as your company name.
Specifies the unique identifier for the NAV App. A unique identifier will be generated if a value is not provided. The same unique identifier should be used for each new version of the NAV App.
Specifies the brief description for the NAV App.
Specifies the description for the NAV App.

Specifies the version of the NAV App. The version is a string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision, with a default value of 1.0.0.0 if not provided. The value should be incremented for each new version of the NAV App.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the NAV App. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision, with a default value of 1.0.0.0 if not provided. The value is used to indicate whether there are compatibility related code changes between different versions of the NAV App. If a new version of the NAV App does not break compatibility, leave the compatibility ID the same as the previous version.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NAV App Privacy Statement.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NAV AppEnd User License Agreement.

Specifies the path to a package file (.navx) for another NAV App that this NAV App is dependent on. Use a comma (,) to separate the paths to multiple .navx files., such as in the following example: C:\Proseware\SmartAppBase.navx, C:\Proseware\ProsewareBase.navx

Specifies the objects that must exist in order to deploy the NAV App to a Microsoft Dynamics NAV server instance. The prerequisites is a string in the format of type=ID, where type can be any NAV object type such as Table, CodeUnit, or Page. Use a comma (,) to separate the prerequisites, such as in the following example: Table=397, CodeUnit=78
Specifies the name of the NAV App.
Specifies the name of the NAV App.
This is an alias of the Name parameter.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App, such as your company name.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App, such as your company name.
This is an alias of the Publisher parameter.
Specifies the unique identifier for the NAV App. A unique identifier will be generated if a value is not provided. The same unique identifier should be used for each new version of the NAV App.
Specifies the unique identifier for the NAV App. A unique identifier will be generated if a value is not provided. The same unique identifier should be used for each new version of the NAV App.
This is an alias of the Id parameter.
Specifies the brief description for the NAV App.
Specifies the brief description for the NAV App.
This is an alias of the Brief parameter.
Specifies the description for the NAV App.
Specifies the description for the NAV App.
This is an alias of the Description parameter.

Specifies the version of the NAV App. The version is a string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision, with a default value of 1.0.0.0 if not provided. The value should be incremented for each new version of the NAV App.

Specifies the version of the NAV App. The version is a string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision, with a default value of 1.0.0.0 if not provided. The value should be incremented for each new version of the NAV App.
This is an alias of the Version parameter.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the NAV App. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision, with a default value of 1.0.0.0 if not provided. The value is used to indicate whether there are compatibility related code changes between different versions of the NAV App. If a new version of the NAV App does not break compatibility, leave the compatibility ID the same as the previous version.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the NAV App. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision, with a default value of 1.0.0.0 if not provided. The value is used to indicate whether there are compatibility related code changes between different versions of the NAV App. If a new version of the NAV App does not break compatibility, leave the compatibility ID the same as the previous version.
This is an alias of the CompatibilityId parameter.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NAV App Privacy Statement.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NAV App Privacy Statement.
This is an alias of the PrivacyStatement parameter.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NAV AppEnd User License Agreement.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NAV AppEnd User License Agreement.
This is an alias of the Eula parameter.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NAV App help site.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NAV App help site.
This is an alias of the Help parameter.
Specifies a generic hyperlink.
Specifies a generic hyperlink.
This is an alias of the Url parameter.

Specifies the objects that must exist in order to deploy the NAV App to a Microsoft Dynamics NAV server instance. The prerequisites is a string in the format of type=ID, where type can be any NAV object type such as Table, CodeUnit, or Page. Use a comma (,) to separate the prerequisites, such as in the following example: Table=397, CodeUnit=78

Specifies the path to a package file (.navx) for another NAV App that this NAV App is dependent on. Use a comma (,) to separate the paths to multiple .navx files., such as in the following example: C:\Proseware\SmartAppBase.navx, C:\Proseware\ProsewareBase.navx
By property name: Name
By property name: Publisher
By property name: Id
By property name: Brief
By property name: Description
By property name: Version
By property name: CompatibilityId
By property name: PrivacyStatement
By property name: Eula
By property name: Help
By property name: Url
By property name: Prerequisites
By property name: Dependencies

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 1 ----------
command:example.dev:code:
New-NavAppManifest -Name "Proseware SmartApp" -Publisher "Proseware, Inc." -Description "First NAV App by Proseware"
AppId : 384ed42e-534b-491f-9c4b-dfc8140bbc38 AppName : Proseware SmartApp AppPublisher : Proseware, Inc. AppDescription : First NAV App by Proseware AppBrief : AppVersion : 1.0.0.0 AppCompatibilityId : 1.0.0.0 AppPrivacyStatement: AppEula : AppHelp : AppUrl : AppLogo : AppScreenShots : Capabilities : {} Prerequisites : {} Dependencies : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new in-memory manifest object with the provided property values and defaults for properties not provided.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 2 ----------
command:example.dev:code:
New-NavAppManifest -Name "Proseware SmartApp" -Publisher "Proseware, Inc." -Brief "First Proseware App" -Description "The first NAV App created by Proseware" -Version "2.3.4.500" -CompatibilityId "2.0.0.0" -Id 384ed42e-534b-491f-9c4b-dfc8140bbc38 -Dependencies C:\Proseware\SmartAppBase.navx, C:\Proseware\ProsewareBase.navx -Prerequisites Table=397, CodeUnit=78 -PrivacyStatement http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/privacypolicy.aspx -Ula http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/ULA.aspx -Help http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/Support.aspx -Url http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/
AppId : 384ed42e-534b-491f-9c4b-dfc8140bbc38 AppName : Proseware SmartApp AppPublisher : Proseware, Inc. AppDescription : First NAV App by Proseware AppBrief : First Proseware App AppVersion : 2.3.4.500 AppCompatibilityId : 2.0.0.0 AppPrivacyStatement: http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/privacypolicy.aspx AppEula : http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/ULA.aspx AppHelp : http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/Support.aspx AppUrl : http://www.proseware.com/SmartApp/ AppLogo : AppScreenShot : Capabilities : {} Prerequisites : {Table=397, CodeUnit=78} Dependencies : {SmartApp Base, Proseware Inc., 2.0.0.300, Proseware Base, Proseware Inc, 2.0.0.0}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new in-memory manifest object with values provided for all properties.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 3 ----------
command:example.dev:code: New-NavAppManifest -Name "Proseware SmartApp" -Publisher "Proseware, Inc." -Description "First NAV App by Proseware" | New-NavAppManifestFile -Path ".\Manifest-Proseware SmartApp.xml"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example uses New-NAVAPPManifestFile cmdlet to persist the new in-memory manifest to a file. This can then be saved under source control for later use.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 4 ----------
command:example.dev:code: New-NAVAppManifest -Name "Proseware SmartApp" -Publisher "Proseware, Inc." -Description "First NAV App by Proseware" | New-NAVAppPackage -Path 'C:\Proseware SmartApp.navx' -SourcePath C:\NavAppFiles

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example shows how to pass the in-memory manifest to New-NAVAppPackage cmdlet to get a .navx file.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets one or more available properties on an in-memory manifest.

Use the Set-NAVAppManifest cmdlet to set properties on an in-memory manifest object. You can create the manifest object by using the New-NAVAppManifest cmdlet. You can then write the updated manifest object to disk by using the New-NAVAppManifestFile cmdlet. The manifest is required when creating the NAV App package file (.navx) using the New-NAVAppPackage cmdlet.
Specifies the manifest object on which the properties are to be set by the cmdlet's parameter values.
Specifies the brief description for the NAV App.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the NAV App. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision. The value is used to indicate whether there are compatibility related code changes between different versions of the NAV App.

Specifies the path to a package file (.navx) for another NAV App that this NAV App is dependent on. Use a comma (,) to separate the paths to multiple .navx files, such as in the following example: C:\Proseware\SmartAppBase.navx, C:\Proseware\ProsewareBase.navx
Specifies the description for the NAV App.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NavApp End User License Agreement.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NavApp help site.
Specifies the unique identifier for the NAV App. A unique identifier will be generated if a value is not provided. The same unique identifier should be used for each new version of the NAV App.
Specifies the name of the NAV App.

Specifies the objects that must exist in order to deploy the NAV App to a NAV server instance. The prerequisites is a string in the format of type=ID, where type would include NAV object types like Table, CodeUnit, Page, etc. Use a comma (,) to separate the prerequisites. (example: Table=397, CodeUnit=78)
Specifies a hyperlink to the NavApp Privacy Statement.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App.
Specifies a generic hyperlink.
Specifies the version of the NAV App. The version is a string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision. The value should be incremented for each new version of the NAV App.
Specifies the manifest object on which the properties are to be set by the cmdlet's parameter values.
Specifies the unique identifier for the NAV App. A unique identifier will be generated if a value is not provided. The same unique identifier should be used for each new version of the NAV App.
Specifies the unique identifier for the NAV App. A unique identifier will be generated if a value is not provided. The same unique identifier should be used for each new version of the NAV App.
This is an alias of the Id parameter.
Specifies the name of the NAV App.
Specifies the name of the NAV App.
This is an alias of the Name parameter.
Specifies the publisher of the NAV App.

Specifies the brief description for the NAV App.

Specifies the version of the NAV App. The version is a string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision. The value should be incremented for each new version of the NAV App.
Specifies the version of the NAV App. The version is a string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision. The value should be incremented for each new version of the NAV App.
This is an alias of the Version parameter.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the NAV App. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision. The value is used to indicate whether there are compatibility related code changes between different versions of the NAV App.

Specifies the compatibility ID of the NAV App. The compatibility ID is a version string in the format of Major.Minor.Build.Revision. The value is used to indicate whether there are compatibility related code changes between different versions of the NAV App.
This is an alias of the CompatibilityId parameter.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NavApp Privacy Statement.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NavApp Privacy Statement.

Specifies a hyperlink to the NavApp End User License Agreement.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NavApp End User License Agreement.
This is an alias of the Eula parameter.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NavApp help site.
Specifies a hyperlink to the NavApp help site.
This is an alias of the Help parameter.
Specifies a generic hyperlink.
Specifies a generic hyperlink.
This is an alias of the Url parameter.

Specifies the objects that must exist in order to deploy the NAV App to a NAV server instance. The prerequisites is a string in the format of type=ID, where type would include NAV object types like Table, CodeUnit, Page, etc. Use a comma (,) to separate the prerequisites. (example: Table=397, CodeUnit=78)

Specifies the path to a package file (.navx) for another NAV App that this NAV App is dependent on. Use a comma (,) to separate the paths to multiple .navx files, such as in the following example: C:\Proseware\SmartAppBase.navx, C:\Proseware\ProsewareBase.navx
Manifest

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 1 ----------
command:example.dev:code:
New-NavAppManifest -Name "Proseware SmartApp" -Publisher "Proseware, Inc." -Description "First NAV App by Proseware" | Set-NavAppManifest -Version 2.3.4.500 -CompatibilityId 2.0.0.0
AppId : 16f55eab-44d2-4428-8550-040b63308e72 AppName : Proseware SmartApp AppPublisher : Proseware, Inc. AppDescription : First NAV App by Proseware AppBrief : AppVersion : 2.3.4.500 AppCompatibilityId : 2.0.0.0 AppPrivacyStatement: AppEula : AppHelp : AppUrl : AppLogo : AppScreenShots : Capabilities : {} Prerequisites : {} Dependencies : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new manifest with a few properties and then passes the created manifest to the Set-NAVAppManifest cmdlet in order to set the version and compatibilityId properties.
This example gets a manifest from file, sets the version and compatibilityId properties and then saves the updated manifest back to file. The -Force parameter overwrites the existing file.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a file with metadata for a NAV App package.
Use the New-NAVAppManifestFile cmdlet to create a file with metadata for a NAV App package.
Specifies the path to the NAV App manifest file to create.
Specifies the manifest object to write to file. You can pass this object from the New-NAVAppManifest or Get-NAVAppManifest cmdlets to the New-NAVAppManifestFile cmdlet.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation to overwrite an existing manifest file at the given path.
Returns the path to the manifest file.
Specifies the path to the NAV App manifest file to create.
Specifies the manifest object to write to file. You can pass this object from the New-NAVAppManifest or Get-NAVAppManifest cmdlets to the New-NAVAppManifestFile cmdlet.
Returns the path to the manifest file.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation to overwrite an existing manifest file at the given path.
Manifest

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 1 ----------
command:example.dev:code: New-NavAppManifest -Name "Proseware SmartApp" -Publisher "Proseware, Inc." -Description "First NAV App by Proseware" | New-NavAppManifestFile -Path ".\Manifest-Proseware SmartApp.xml" -Force

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates an in-memory manifest and then writes it to disk. The -Force parameter will overwrite the file if it already exists.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a NAV App package file (.navx) at the specified location based on the specified manifest file and source files.
Use the New-NAVAppPackage cmdlet to create a .navx package file to distribute a NAV App. You can then use the package file to deploy the NAV App to a Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Specifies the file name and the location where the NAV App package file (.navx) must be placed.

Specifies the manifest object that contains the metadata that defines the NAV App package. You can pass this object from the New-NAVAppManifest or Get-NAVAppManifest cmdlets to the New-NAVAppPackage cmdlet.

Specifies the location of the delta files and full object files, or a folder that contains the files, that you want to include in the NAV App package. Use a comma (,) to separate multiple paths as in the following example: C:\NavAppFiles\, C:\Permissions\PermissionSet.xml
Specifies the path to and image file to use as the logo when creating this Nav App package

Specifies the path(s) to the image and files, or a directory containing such, to include as product screen shots in the NAV App package. Use a comma (,) to separate multiple paths. (example: C:\NavAppImages\, C:\Images\ScreenShot.jpg)
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation to overwrite an existing package file at the given path.
Returns the path of the created package file.
Specifies the file name and the location where the NAV App package file (.navx) must be placed.
Specifies the file name and the location where the NAV App package file (.navx) must be placed.
This is an alias of the Path parameter.
Specifies the file name and the location where the NAV App package file (.navx) must be placed.
This is an alias of the Path parameter.

Specifies the manifest object that contains the metadata that defines the NAV App package. You can pass this object from the New-NAVAppManifest or Get-NAVAppManifest cmdlets to the New-NAVAppPackage cmdlet.

Specifies the location of the delta files and full object files, or a folder that contains the files, that you want to include in the NAV App package. Use a comma (,) to separate multiple paths as in the following example: C:\NavAppFiles\, C:\Permissions\PermissionSet.xml
Specifies the path to and image file to use as the logo when creating this Nav App package

Specifies the path(s) to the image and files, or a directory containing such, to include as product screen shots in the NAV App package. Use a comma (,) to separate multiple paths. (example: C:\NavAppImages\, C:\Images\ScreenShot.jpg)
Returns the path of the created package file.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation to overwrite an existing package file at the given path.
By property name: Path
Manifest
SourcePath
By property name: Logo
ScreenShots

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new NAV App package using new in-memory NAV App manifest metadata and the source files in the C:\NavAppFiles folder.
This example creates a new NAV App package using the NAV App manifest file and source files in the C:\NavAppFiles folder.
This example creates a new NAV App package using the NAV App manifest file and source files in the C:\NavAppFiles folder and an exported permission set file in the location provided.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 4 ----------
command:example.dev:code: Get-NAVAppManifest -Path '.\Manifest-Proseware SmartStuff.xml' | New-NAVAppPackage -Path 'C:\Proseware SmartStuff.navx' -SourcePath C:\NavAppFiles, 'C:\permissions.xml' -Logo C:\SmartLogo.png -ScreenShots C:\SmartScreenShots

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new NAV App package using the NAV App manifest file and source files in the C:\NavAppFiles folder, an exported permission set file in the location provided, a logo image in the location provided, and screen shot images files in the C:\SmartScreenShots folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the specified permission set(s) from a Microsoft Dynamics NAV database to a file.
Use the Export-NAVAppPermissionSet cmdlet to export a permission set (or multiple permission sets) from a Microsoft Dynamics NAV database to a file.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Specifies the permission set ID(s) that will be exported.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies the permission set ID(s) that will be exported.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By property name: PermissionSetId
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Path

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the permission set with the ID "PSA-VIEW" in the database that is used by the DynamicsNAV server instance to the PermissionSet.xml file.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 2 ----------
command:example.dev:code:
$PermissionSetFile=Export-NAVAppPermissionSet -ServerInstance DynamicsNAV -Path '.\PermissionSet.xml' -PermissionSetId PSA-VIEW -PassThru
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- -a--- 8/5/2017 11:47 AM 450 PermissionSet.xml

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the permission set with the ID "PSA-VIEW" in the database that is used by the DynamicsNAV server instance to the PermissionSet.xml file, and then returns the location of the file to a variable. The variable could then be used when creating a package. (Example: Get-NAVAppManifest -Path '.\Manifest-Proseware SmartStuff.xml' | New-NAVAppPackage -Path 'C:\Proseware SmartStuff.navx' -SourcePath C:\NavExtensionFiles, $PermissionSetFile

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the specified custom report layout from a Microsoft Dynamics NAV database to a file.
Use the Export-NAVAppReportLayout cmdlet to export a custom report layout from a Microsoft Dynamics NAV database to a file.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the Code of the report layout that will be exported.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the Code of the report layout that will be exported.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By property name: LayoutCode
By property name: Tenant
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Path

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the report layout with the code 'MS-1016-DEFAULT' in the database that is used by the DynamicsNAV server instance to the ReportLayout.layoutdata file.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 2 ----------
command:example.dev:code:
Export-NAVAppReportLayout -ServerInstance DynamicsNAV -Path .\ReportLayout.layoutdata -LayoutId MS-1016-DEFAULT -PassThru
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- -a--- 11/25/2017 11:47 AM 450 ReportLayout.xml

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the report layout with the code 'MS-1016-DEFAULT' in the database that is used by the DynamicsNAV server instance to the ReportLayout.layoutdata file, then returns the location of the file.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports data from a Microsoft Dynamics NAV database table to file.

Use the Export-NAVAppTableData cmdlet to export table data from a Microsoft Dynamics NAV database to a file. The data must be for a new non-company table created as part of the extension package to which the exported file will be included.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to the folder where the export file should be written. A data file with a name of TAB<TABLEID>.navxdata will be created. (Example: TAB10000.navxdata)
Specifies the table ID to export. The ID must be for a new non-company table created as part of the extension.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
This is an alias of the Tenant parameter.
Specifies the path to the folder where the export file should be written. A data file with a name of TAB<TABLEID>.navxdata will be created. (Example: TAB10000.navxdata)
Specifies the table ID to export. The ID must be for a new non-company table created as part of the extension.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Tenant
By property name: Path
By property name: TableId

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the data from the table with the ID 10000 in the default tenant database for server instance DynamicsNAV to a TAB10000.navxdata file in the current folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the specified web service from a Microsoft Dynamics NAV database to a file.
Use the Export-NAVAppTenantWebService cmdlet to export a web service from a Microsoft Dynamics NAV database to a file.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the object ID of the web service that will be exported.
Specifies the object type of the web service that will be exported.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Specifies the service name of the web service that will be exported.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the service name of the web service that will be exported.
Specifies the object type of the web service that will be exported.
Specifies the object ID of the web service that will be exported.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
Specifies the tenant from which to export data. If the server instance is configured for single tenant, do not set the parameter.
This is an alias of the Tenant parameter.
Specifies the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance that the NAV App is published to, such as DynamicsNAV.
Specifies the path to the Extension Package file that you want to publish to the Microsoft Dynamics NAV Server instance.
Returns an Extension object for the published Extension. The Extension object contains the properties of the Extension, such as name, publisher, version.
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.
By property name: ServiceName
By property name: ObjectType
By property name: ObjectId
By property name: Tenant
By value and by property name: ServerInstance
By property name: Path

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the web service with the name "Customer" on the Page 21 object in the database that is used by the DynamicsNAV server instance to the TenantWebService.xml file.

command:example.maml:title: ---------- EXAMPLE 2 ----------
command:example.dev:code:
Export-NAVAppTenantWebService -ServerInstance DynamicsNAV -Path .\TenantWebService.xml -ServiceName Customer -ObjectType Page -ObjectId 21 -PassThru
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- -a--- 11/25/2017 11:47 AM 450 TenantWebService.xml

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example exports the web service with the name "Customer" on the Page 21 object in the database that is used by the DynamicsNAV server instance to the TenantWebService.xml file, then returns the location of the file.
